citations.narrative:
On December 12, 2025, around 10:00am, two animal care staff members were bitten by 12-year-old female binturong,
named “Lola”. As “Lola” was being directed back into her winter enclosure she turned around and grab the leg of an
animal care staff member. She then bit the animal care staff member and would not let go. An animal care colleague that
was present to assist was also bitten as he removed “Lola” and placed her in a separate enclosure.
At the time of the incident, “Lola” was housed in a new winter housing. The enclosure did not have the same design
feature as the previous enclosure, which more effectively facilitated animal enclosure transfers. When the incident
occurred, an alternative method of animal transfer was used per SOP. The binturong acted negatively to the changes.
Animals must be handled in a manner that does not cause behavioral stress. Correct by January 17, 2026
NOTE; At the time of inspection, “Lola’s” safety risk was increased and a work order placed to add the animal transfer
design feature.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
This is a focused inspection to evaluate the animal care program for binturongs, seals, and sea lions.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
On December 12, 2025, around 10:00am, two animal care staff members were bitten by 12-year-old female binturong, 
named “Lola”. As “Lola” was being directed back into her winter enclosure she turned around and grab the leg of an 
animal care staff member. She then bit the animal care staff member and would not let go. An animal care colleague that 
was present to assist was also bitten as he removed “Lola” and placed her in a separate enclosure.  
 
At the time of the incident, “Lola” was housed in a new winter housing. The enclosure did not have the same design 
feature as the previous enclosure, which more effectively facilitated animal enclosure transfers. When the incident 
occurred, an alternative method of animal transfer was used per SOP. The binturong acted negatively to the changes. 
Animals must be handled in a manner that does not cause behavioral stress. Correct by January 17, 2026 
 
NOTE; At the time of inspection, “Lola’s” safety risk was increased and a work order placed to add the animal transfer 
design feature. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
This is a focused inspection to evaluate the animal care program for binturongs, seals, and sea lions. 
 
 n
